decks.notes: This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly to bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista. The key concept revolves around using Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to accelerate the mana base while utilizing Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble to enhance the creatures on the board. The inclusion of Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker provides a strong defense against opposing threats, while cards like Kozilek's Command and Vexing Bauble offer versatility in disrupting the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on combo potential and overwhelming the opponent with potent creatures.

The deck relies on assembling the Amulet of Vigor with land ramp and Primeval Titan to create a powerful combo that can generate a lot of mana and overwhelm the opponent with big threats. It also includes other combo pieces like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to further enhance the deck's ability to quickly close out the game. The deck's focus on utilizing lands and powerful creatures makes it a versatile and resilient option in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells. It aims to efficiently trade resources and maintain card advantage while slowly building up its own win conditions. By disrupting the opponent's plays and limiting their options, the Dimir Control deck can take control of the game and dictate the pace and outcome. The deck also includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out artifact creatures and using various artifacts to control the board and disrupt opponents. By utilizing cards like Engineered Explosives, Metallic Rebuke, and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to keep opponents off balance while generating card advantage through Thoughtcast. Urza's Saga provides additional threats and allows for fetching key artifacts. The mixture of creatures, artifacts, and spells creates a versatile aggro strategy that can overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo of Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp into big threats and overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to help find key pieces of the combo. The mana base is designed to maximize the deck's potential by including lands that can produce multiple colors and provide additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and generate overwhelming board presence to outpace and outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting to help cast powerful creatures like Hollow One and Phoenix early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Orcish Bowmasters to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main goal is to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while using cards like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board. Finally, the deck has a mana base that supports its fast and aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards that reduce the cost of spells, generate mana, and draw cards to enable explosive turns where the player can cast a high number of spells in quick succession to generate a significant amount of mana and deal massive damage with spells like Grapeshot. The deck also includes combo pieces like Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and Wish to tutor for specific cards needed to win the game. The goal is to create a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent in a single turn.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the board and opponent's actions through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as sweepers like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of the Skies. The deck also utilizes interaction with cards like Spell Snare, Prismatic Ending, and Solitude to handle threats efficiently. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent while maintaining control of the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on casting aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently, combining multicolor creatures with powerful spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt to deal damage to the opponent swiftly. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and burn spells, utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact to support the multicolor strategy. With a mix of low-cost creatures and efficient removal, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up to play powerful lands and creatures, including Primeval Titan, to generate massive amounts of mana and search for key pieces like Amulet of Vigor. It combines land ramp with combo potential, using cards like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga to assemble a lethal board state. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Malevolent Rumble and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of land-based ramp and explosive finishes.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures like Ocelot Pride and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also using powerful spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to keep up the pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provides additional support and versatility to the deck. Cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Voice of Victory offer a strong finisher, while Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and utility lands like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ocelot Pride and Voice of Victory enhances the creature's power and resilience, allowing for more aggressive plays. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using cards like Basking Broodscale, Malevolent Rumble, and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to generate value and overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes various creatures and spells to support the combo, including Walking Ballista and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician. The deck aims to control the board and build a strong presence while setting up for a game-winning combo. It includes lands like Verdant Catacombs and Boseiju, Who Endures to help facilitate its strategy.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory while also applying aggressive pressure with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to control the board. Additionally, cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage and help maintain the tempo of the game. By combining disruption with aggressive threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. It utilizes powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Consign to Memory to control the board, while also using cards like Quantum Riddler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure early on. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down opponents' plays. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while steadily advancing its own board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly milling the opponent's deck by utilizing cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Fractured Sanity. It also uses Archive Trap, Surgical Extraction, and Drown in the Loch to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Visions of Beyond provides card draw, while Jace, the Perfected Mind offers a win condition. The deck includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Field of Ruin, as well as cantrips like Preordain to smooth out draws. Tasha's Hideous Laughter and Mind Funeral provide additional mill effects, making it difficult for opponents to recover.
